snippet: After doctors gave Kevin McCarthy a 1-in-10 chance of surviving a shooting spree on a train, no one would have guessed what his life would look like 18 years later.
abstract: Michael Wilson Crime Scene column on Kevin McCarthy, who was shot in 1993 aboard a Long Island Rail Road commuter train in a shooting spree by gunman Colin Ferguson that killed his father Dennis McCarthy; Kevin, who was given a 1-in-10 chance of survival, has overcome severe head trauma to lead a quiet life on Long Island with his wife and two children.
lead_paragraph: After doctors gave Kevin McCarthy a 1-in-10 chance of surviving a shooting spree on a train, no one would have guessed what his life would look like 18 years later.

headline.seo: Taking a Bullet to the Head, and Beating the Odds
headline.main: During an Ill-Fated Trip, Taking a Bullet to the Head and Beating the Odds
headline.print_headline: During an Ill-Fated Trip, Taking a Bullet to the Head and Beating the Odds
